column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of α-CuV2O6 were synthesized by\rfiring CuO (99.999%, Alfa Aesar) and V2O5 (99.999%, Alfa\rAesar) in a porcelain crucible.
#Text=In a first step, the thoroughly\rmixed powder was annealed to 540 ◦C, then ground again\rin an agate mortar and heated to 610 ◦C [40].
#Text=Crystals of\rα-CuV2O6 were grown from the powder by chemical vapor\rphase transport (CVT) in a temperature gradient from 600 ◦C\rto 500 ◦C using TeCl4 as a transport agent.
#Text=The powder samples\rwere initially characterized with respect to phase purity\rby x-ray powder diffraction at room temperature using MoKα1\rradiation.

#Text=High-resolution neutron powder diffraction patterns\rwere collected at 1.5 K on the high-resolution two-axis\rdiffractometer D2B installed at the Institut Laue-Langevin\r(ILL, Grenoble) using neutrons of 1.594 Å wavelength.
#Text=The\rsample of ∼9 g was filled into a thin-walled vanadium tubular\rcontainer of 8-mm outer diameter.

#Text=Rietveld refinements\rby varying the lattice parameters and atom positions were\rperformed in the triclinic space group P-1 (No. 2) using the\rFULLPROF software package assuming a pseudo-Voigt peak\rprofile (FULLPROF NPR = 5) [42].
#Text=Isotropic and anisotropic\rdisplacement parameters were tested in case of the x-ray\rand neutron diffraction patterns, respectively.
#Text=The background\rwas modeled by a higher-order Chebychev polynomial.
#Text=The\rrefinements typically converged to Bragg- and Rf -reliability\rfactors of ∼2% or less and χ2-values better than 1 were\rachieved for the x-ray patterns.
#Text=For the neutron diffraction,\rthe reliability factors were somewhat larger (see Table SI in\rthe Supplemental Material [35] for more structure details).
#Text=Medium-resolution high-intensity neutron powder diffraction\rwas performed between 1.5 K and 30 K on ILL’s diffractometer\rD20 at a wavelength of 2.42 Å.
#Text=DC magnetization\rmeasurements versus magnetic field and temperature were\rperformed in a Magnetic Property Measurement System employing\rthe RSO option (Quantum Design, MPMSXL).
#Text=The needle-shaped crystals were oriented with the a axis (P-1\rsetting, needle axis) parallel and perpendicular to the magnetic\rfield.

#Text=Heat-capacity measurements on a crystal grown\rin a V2O5−K2SO4 melt [29] as well as on a CVT crystal\rwere performed in a physical property measurement system\r(Quantum Design, PPMS) in magnetic fields up to 9 T with\rthe field oriented perpendicular to the crystal needles.
